{{Infobox writer |image = V.Arenev at Jersey Zoo, 2012.jpg |imagesize = 200px | name = Vladimir Arenev | pseudonym = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|10|1}} | birth_place = [[Kiev]], Ukraine | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = writer, journalist, editor, screenwriter, translator | nationality = [[Ukraine|Ukrainian]] | period = 1998 — present | genre = [[Science-fiction]], [[Fantasy]] for adults and young adults | subject = | movement = | spouse = | children = | relatives = | influences = | influenced = | signature = }} '''Vladimir Arenev''' ({{Lang-uk|italic=yes|Володимир Арєнєв}}, {{lang-ru|italic=yes|Владимир Аренев)}} is a [[pen name]] of [[Ukrainians|Ukrainian]] [[science fiction]], [[fantasy]] award winning writer, journalist and screenwriter Vladimir Puziy. Writes in [[Russian language|Russian]] and [[Ukrainian language|Ukrainian]] languages, resides in [[Kiev]], [[Ukraine]].
==Biography==
Vladimir Konstantinovich Puziy ({{lang-uk|Володимир Костянтинович Пузій}}) was born October 1, 1978 in Kiev. In school he was very fond of [[biology]], attended young naturalists group at Kiev Zoo, admired [[Gerald Durrell]] and [[James Herriot]], and seriously engaged in keeping exotic amphibians and insects in [[vivarium]] at home. In 1995 applied to Biological faculty, but failed.<ref>[http://www.bukvaved.net/biography/20200-biografija.html Biography at Russian book database Bukvaved.net] {{uk icon}}</ref> For the next year Arenev worked as a sweeper at Kiev Zoo. In 1996 he successfully applied to [[Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv|Institute of Journalism of Taras Shevchenko National University of Kyiv]].<ref>[http://fantlab.ru/autor1286 Vladimir Arenev's biography at FantLab.ru] {{ru icon}}</ref> After receiving [[Master’s Degree]] with distinction he started teaching the [[history of literature]] and numerous students’ courses on writing skills.
==Science fiction and fantasy writer==
For the time being Arenev has 21 books published in Ukrainian and [[Russian language|Russian]]. His numerous short stories and novellas have been published in [[Ukrainian language|Ukrainian]], [[Russian language|Russian]], [[Polish language|Polish]], [[Lithuanian language|Lithuanian]], [[Estonian language|Estonian]], [[French language|French]] and [[English language|English]]<ref>[http://internationalsf.wordpress.com/2013/04/19/anthology-of-european-sf/ Anthology of European Speculative Fiction, 2013, edited by Cristian Tamas and Roberto Mendes]</ref> (more than 150 publications in periodicals and anthologies)<sup>,</sup>.<ref name="star-bridge1">[http://star-bridge.org/?section=library&subsection=ukrfan/02Arenev Biography at the Star Bridge Award official website] {{ru icon}}</ref> Debuted in fiction in 1998 with science fiction short story "Guardian Angel" ({{lang-ru|Ангел-хранитель}}) published in the first issue "Maidan XXI" anthology.
First usage of pen-name Vladimir Arenev dates 2000, when he started a series of typical mainstream [[Works inspired by J. R. R. Tolkien|post-Tolkien]] fantasy.<ref name="autogenerated2003">[http://dt.ua/CULTURE/geroy_tusovkovih_chasiv-36139.html Interview in Dzerkalo Tyzhnia newspaper (October 04, 2003)] {{ru icon}} {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120503012725/http://dt.ua/CULTURE/geroy_tusovkovih_chasiv-36139.html |date=May 3, 2012 }}</ref> This period ended at 2005 and after a pause Arenev changed the format, working on fiction with a social narrative since 2008. Arenev’s short stories and novellas were published at such anthologies as "Best of the year" ({{lang-ru|Лучшее за год}}) and "New Legends" ({{lang-ru|Новые легенды}}) at Azbuka Publishing House ({{lang-ru|Азбука}}), "SF&Fantasy" ({{lang-ru|Фантастика}}) at [[AST (publisher)|AST]], "Fantasy" ({{lang-ru|Фэнтези}}) at [[Eksmo]], and in several magazines in [[Ukraine]], [[Russia]], [[Lithuania]], [[Germany]] and [[Poland]].
==Journalist, editor, translator==
Under his name Vladimir Puziy is known as awarded [[Literary criticism|literary critic]] and [[Review|book reviewer]], lecturer at SF&Fantasy conventions on [[Literary criticism]] issues.<ref>{{sv icon}} [http://www.aftonbladet.se/kultur/huvudartikel/article13211197.ab Coverage of Eurocon 2011 at Stockholm]</ref> Also works as a freelance journalist for newspapers and magazines in Kiev, [[Moscow]] and [[Saint-Petersburg]].<ref>{{ru icon}} [http://fantlab.ru/autor1286 Fiction Bibliography and list of articles at Fanlab.ru]</ref> * 1999–2003 — an executive editor of students anthology ‘Sviatiy Volodymyr’ ({{lang-uk|Святий Володимир}}). * 2003–2006 — regular author at "Realnost’ Fantastiki" ({{lang-ru|Реальность фантастики}}) magazine, Moscow.<ref>{{ru icon}} [http://www.rf.com.ua/people;jsessionid=2C417184086E0A073018AFDF6A3EE905?id=35 Numerous Arenev’s (as Vladimir Puziy) articles at ''Realnost' Fantastiki'']</ref> * 2004–present — author at "[[Mir Fantastiki]]" ({{lang-ru|Мир фантастики}}) magazine, Moscow, columnist at "Modern intellectual prose" section since 2010.<ref>{{ru icon}} [http://www.mirf.ru/ShowAuthor.php?show_author=83 Numerous Arenev’s (as Vladimir Puziy) articles at [[Mir Fantastiki]]]</ref> * 2005–2008 — supervisor of screenplay department of "Ragnesis-online" [[MMORPG]] project ("[[SpeedTree|Intelligent Soft]]") developing the game world and coordinating screenwriters. The matherial was also used<ref>{{ru icon}} [http://www.kultprosvet.ua/peoples/4bcc76986253c/ Interview at Kultprosvet.ua]</ref> for the novel "An Affair of Honour". * 2011–present — biographical and historical articles at "Lichnosti" ({{lang-ru|Личности}}) magazine, Kiev. Arenev also participated in editorial process of numerous fiction anthologies. Currently supervises and edits the "Dark fantasy" series of ‘Ripol-classic’ ({{lang-ru|Рипол-классик}}) Publishing House, [[Moscow]]. He wrote [[foreword]]s and [[afterword]]s to the books of the well-known fantasy writers [[Maryna and Serhiy Dyachenko]], [[H. L. Oldie]], [[Jacek Piekara]], Dmytro Skiriuk. Translated [[Glen Cook]]’s "Tides Elba" short story and [[Andrzej Sapkowski]]’s "Spanienkreuz" into Russian (2011). Translation editor of [[Jacek Dukaj]]’s short novel "[[Serce Mroku]]", [[Jakub Nowak]]’s short novel ({{lang-ru|Доминичка говорит}}) and [[Jacek Piekara]]’s novels about [[:pl:Cykl Inkwizytorski|Mordimer Madderdin]] published in Russia.
==Literary Awards==
Vladimir Arenev was awarded with various literary awards in the science fiction and fantasy in the [[Commonwealth of Independent States]] and [[Europe]].<ref>[http://fantlab.ru/autor1286/awards List of Vladimir Arenev’s awards at FantLab.ru] {{ru icon}}</ref> Featured awards are: # [[Eurocon|EuroCon (ESFS Awards)]] 2004 — Encouragement Award. # Twice nominated (shortlisted) for [[:ru: Дебют (премия)|Debut]] award (for the short stories series "We, humanses" ({{lang-ru|Мы, людики}}) In 2003 and for the novel "All Adam’s Race" ({{lang-ru|Все племя Адамово}}) in 2011. # In 2011 have been at long list for the novel "Rings on the Ground" ({{lang-ru|Круги на земле}}). # International Ukrainian-German O. Gonchar Award for novel "Rules of the Game" ({{lang-ru|Правила игры}}) (2001).<ref>{{Uk icon}} [http://www.day.kiev.ua/64431 Interview in Ukrainian ''Day'' newspaper, August 09, 2001]</ref> # International convent of fiction writers [[:ru:Звёздный мост|Star Bridge]] (received the award 2001, 2005 and have been nominated a number of times).<ref name="star-bridge1"/> # [[Alexander Belayev]] [[:ru:Литературная премия имени Александра Беляева|prize]] (2008). # "Interpresscon" Award in 2006 from the Literary criticism nomination. Also was nominated for the short novel "It Runs in his Blood" ({{lang-ru|То, что в его крови}}) in 2011, for the novel "Magus" ({{lang-ru|Магус}}) in 2007, for the short novel "Speechless Teacher" ({{lang-ru|Немой учитель}}) in 2003. # Nominated for [[The Marble Fawn]] award ({{lang-ru|Мраморный фавн}}) for two articles (2004) and short novel "The White Dame" (2010). # "[[Die Kleine Nordklinge]]" for the best short story published in [[Germany]] in Russian (2003, 2011). # Nominated for "Activation of the Word" Award for the novel "All Adam’s Race" ({{lang-ru|Все племя Адамово}}) in 2011. # "[[FantLab's Book of the Year Award]], 2012", award for best on-line publication for short novel "Souluary" (Ukrainian "Душниця").<ref>[http://fantlab.ru/award86#c3007 FantLab's book of the year award] {{ru icon}}</ref> # Nominated for [[FantLab's Book of the Year Award]] for novel "Master of the Road" ({{lang-ru|Мастер дороги}}) in 2013. # "New Horizons 2014" award for Ukrainian Edition of a short novel "Souluary" ({{lang-uk|Душниця}}). # "Best creator of children’s ScienceFiction or fantasy books",<ref>[http://esfs.info/2014/08/24/415/ ESFS Awards 2014]</ref> Spirit of Dedication [[Eurocon|EuroCon (ESFS Awards)]] 2014 in Dublin, Ireland, for Ukrainian Edition of a short novel "Souluary" ({{lang-uk|Душниця}}). Alexander Prodan also has been awarded for artwork for the book.
